intro: Arthraxon cryptatherus subsp. nudus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grass. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential horticultural use.
